inn1.comm: length ball on a fourth-stump line. Moeen stays inside the line and pokes it towards backward point
full on middle stump, whipped to mid-on, who's stationed fairly wide
on middle stump again, a touch too full, and it's clipped away elegantly to the right of square leg
yorker on off stump, excellent riposte, and he brings his bat down in a hurry from that high backlift and jabs the ball back down the ground
full, a bit of swing in towards off stump. Driven to mid-off
length ball, angling in towards middle and off, defended back to the bowler
Short and wide, doesn't quite come on to the bat. Bell has to reach out a long way to cut and he ends up toe-ending it uppishly, just wide of mid-off
length ball, angling across Moeen towards off stump. Defended from the crease, into the covers
back of a length, the angle gives Moeen a little bit of width outside off, and he opens his bat face and steers the ball to third man
length ball on a fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball wide outside off. Bell slashes at it and slices it in the air, bounces down to third man
full on middle and off, driven to mid-off
full and wide, Bell opens his bat face and drives uppishly, but in the gap between backward point and cover
again it's up there for the drive, but Bell can't beat the man at a square-ish cover
length ball this time, leaving the right-hander from an off-stump line. Bell lets it go
full on off stump, and Bell leans into another elegant drive, places this one between cover and mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot into the off side

full and wide outside off, this seems to be a deliberate ploy from Starc, maybe trying to induce the edge to one of the two slips he has. He does find the edge as Bell goes hard at the ball, but it flies wide of second slip and runs away to the third man boundary
back of a length on middle stump, defended towards mid-on
length ball on off stump, Moeen steps forward and pushes it to the left of cover
on the pads, poor ball, and it's flicked away to the midwicket boundary
digs this one in short, outside off. Bell thinks about pulling, decides against it and leaves it alone
short and wide, you don't bowl there to Bell, who plays the classical square cut, getting on top of the bounce and rolling his wrists over the ball
good response from Cummins, a wide tempter not quite on a driving length, and Bell goes for the big drive and doesn't connect
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Moeen stands tall and looks to punch down the ground, gets a thick inside edge that rolls towards square leg
fullish on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
lovely delivery, a bit of shape in late.  Bell leaves on length, trusting the bounce, and it passes over the top of off stump
full and wide, not quite a half-volley, but that doesn't matter to Bell, who gets his head over the ball and strokes it away, on the up, to the right of cover
on the pads now, clipped away to long leg
back of a length on middle stump. Moeen gets on his toes and defends towards short midwicket
length ball, angling in towards middle stump. Bell stays in his crease and defends towards short midwicket
a touch fuller, on middle and off, Bell plays the checked drive to mid-on
fuller still, on off stump. Driven to mid-on
back of a length outside off, comes in with the angle. Bell defends off the back foot

lovely shot. It's full once again, on off stump, and he shows the full face and eases it down the ground, between Sandhu and mid-off. Henriques, chasing back, can't catch up with the ball and his momentum forces him to execute a high jump over the boundary hoardings
and again, even straighter this time, between the bowler and the stumps. Mid-on slides around to stop it
full again, and there's that straight drive once more, to the left of mid-on, who manages to chase back and stop it on the slide, just short of the rope
short ball, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off. Bell lets it come on and dabs it to third man
beauty. Angled across Moeen, on a length that draws the batsman's weight forward but not his feet, and he ends up off-balance, poking and missing
angled across again, on that not-quite-driving length, and Moeen goes for the drive away from his body and doesn't connect
short again, pulls it in the air, one bounce to the man at deep midwicket
beaten again. It's on a good length, angling away, and he goes for that big drive without really moving his feet
and again. This one's closer to off stump, a little shorter in length, and Moeen looks to dab it away to third man with an angled bat and can't make contact
excellent length again, angling across, and Moeen swipes at it, looking to go over cover, maybe, and he gets a thick outside edge down to third man
full, angling in towards middle stump. Bell stands up tall and punches it back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, dabbed down to third man
back of a length outside off, Moeen opens his bat face and runs it down to third man
back of a length angling across, a bit of extra bounce, and Moeen is beaten again, trying to punch through cover point
bam. This one's a length ball on off stump, and he clears his front leg and swats it hard down the ground but can't beat mid-off
shorter now, and Moeen goes for the pull, not quite in control, hits it in the air, but it's in the gap well to the right of the man at deep square leg, and manages to carry over the rope
short again, pulled again, and it's to the other side of the fielder this time, and it carries even further, into the grass banks. He hit this one much cleaner

and another! Almost a wicket this time. Tests the middle of the pitch again, and he pulls again, and Marsh at deep square leg jumps and plucks it out of the air, but he's falling backwards as he tries to toss the ball back into play, and both fielder and ball end up beyond the boundary
back of a length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length on off stump. Bell rides the bounce and defends into the covers
back of a length outside off, and Bell plays that trademark dab down to third man. Stands tall, lets it come on, and pretty much just lets it hit his bat

goes for the hook again, this was a well-directed bouncer, and he has to take it from over his left shoulder. Not in control at all, and the top edge goes high in the air but drops well short of Maxwell running in from the square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
length ball on a fourth-stump line, and there's that dab to third man once again
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
loopy outside off. Moeen's bottom hand takes over as he goes for the drive, and he hits it hard back to the bowler
some air once again, and Moeen goes for the sweep and misses. Goes with the angle and he's lucky that missed his off stump
length ball on off stump and he comes forward and steers it through cover point
tossed up, angling across towards off stump, and Bell quickly gets into position for the reverse-sweep, beats the diving fielder at short third man
tossed up on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
back of a length just outside off, and Bell helps himself to another dabbed single to third man
back of a length on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler with a roll of the wrists
fullish on middle and off, driven to mid-off
full on leg stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump. Bell shuffles across and clips it towards deep backward square leg
length ball on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
length ball angling across towards middle stump. No turn, and Bell stays in his crease and works it away to deep midwicket
nice loop, angled in towards off stump. Moeen comes forward to defend, it dips on him, goes with the angle, and off the inside half of the bat into the on side
this time he comes forward and gets to the pitch, pushes it wide of the man at short cover

what happened there? Went for the reverse-sweep again, but it was too full for that. Goes with the angle, misses his pads, narrowly misses off stump, and bounces off the keeper's gloves into the leg side
on the pads, worked through midwicket
length ball angling across. Bell shuffles across and works it from outside off through square leg
length ball outside off, punched to short cover
full on middle and off, driven down to long-off to bring up his half-century
good ball, a tiny bit of shape away from the left-hander from outside off. He goes for the cover drive without moving his feet, and edges it down to third man
slower ball, full on middle stump. Bell defends into the on side
yorker on middle stump. Bell gets his feet out of the way and pokes it away to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, clipped to mid-on
on the pads, clipped to short midwicket
down the track, Maxwell shortens his length a touch, and Bell pushes it down the ground to long-on
back of a length on middle stump. Moeen moves his front leg out of the way and punches it down to long-on
shortish, and Bell takes a big step back and across and pulls towards deep square leg
short, down the leg side, and Moeen swivels around and gets just enough bat on it to help it wide of Sandhu at short fine leg
tossed up wide outside off, and Moeen welcomes the swinging room, gets down on one knee and swipes it away to the straight midwicket boundary
slower ball on a good length outside off. Bell chips it quite deliberately, in the air, into the gap between long-off and sweeper cover
full and wide again, another checked drive in the air, bounces down to the left of long-off
very full outside off, and Bell uses his hands adroitly to manoeuvre (correct my spelling if that's wrong) it to the left of sweeper cover
slower ball, back of a length and angling across. Bell looks to steer it square on the off side, can't connect
full on middle stump, driven down to long-off
excellent delivery, on a fullish but not driving length outside off. Moeen pushes at it, his hands going at the ball and his feet following a fortnight later, and his bat swishes at thin air
length ball on off stump. Bell defends with the angle towards short midwicket
shortish outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven firmly down the ground but mid-off dives to his left to stop it. Finch, I think.
full on middle and off, Bell gets his front foot out of the way and pushes it to the right of the fielder at sweeper cover
full again, good-looking drive but he can't beat the alert Smith at short cover
on the pads and he clips it away towards deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump. Moeen shuffles across and works it with the angle to deep midwicket
slower ball on middle and off. Bell gets on his toes and clips it towards square leg

gone. Moeen runs down the track, and Faulkner bowls a shortish slower ball. He swings across the line, and the extra bounce forces him to top-edge it high in the air, and the man at short cover settles comfortably under it
fullish outside off, and he comes forward to push it to short cover
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, poked away to backward point
fullish on leg stump, clipped away to deep midwicket
length ball a short distance outside off, left alone
slower ball on off stump. Bell comes forward and pushes it to long-on. Was in the air for a bit but always a safe shot
back of a length outside off, beats Taylor as he plays a weird-looking attempted dab to third man
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump. Looks to work it leg side with an angled bat, gets a leading edge into the off side
back of a length outside off, dabbed to the left of point, where Smith makes a good diving save
back of a length outside off, and Bell Bells it to third man
fullish outside off and he moves into a confident-looking drive that is intercepted by short cover
length ball on middle stump, pushed to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, poked away to cover point
back of a length, a bit of width, and he cuts it away to the right of third man
shortish and wide, Bell goes for the cut and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
full on off stump, driven past the stumps at the other end, down to long-on
shortish, pulled down to deep backward square leg
back of a length on middle stump, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
shortish, a bit of extra bounce on a fourth-stump line. Gets a little big on Taylor, but he manages to control the cut and play it down to third man
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
slower ball on leg stump, pushed to mid-on for a quick single
full outside off, and Bell clears his front leg and swipes it over mid-on. Didn't quite middle it but the placement was pretty good
back of a length outside off, can't beat point with that open-faced steer
in the blockhole on middle stump, low full-toss, in fact. Pushed down the ground to long-off
back of a length on off stump, and Taylor dabs it away to third man
full on middle stump, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, and Bell picks up another single down to third man
gone! That was full on off stump, and Taylor goes for the drive over extra cover, he's too close to the pitch of the ball and ends up toe-ending it and hitting it in the air, straight to mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump. Root gets on the front foot to defend towards short cover
full outside off, driven to mid-off
full again, wider outside off this time, Root opens his bat face to slice the drive towards third man
back of a length angling in towards middle stump. Root shuffles across and tucks it into the leg side
back of a length outside off, and Root gets an opportunity to show off his version of the dab to third man

was that a drop? Bell goes for the cut, and it's too close to him for that, and Haddin dives across to his right to catch the ball that is going downwards after hitting the toe-end of the bat, can't quite hold on with his right glove
fuller now, on middle stump, punched back to the bowler
full on middle stump, clipped away towards deep midwicket
slower ball, very wide, hits the wide line on the full and Bell has no option but to leave
another slower ball, closer to the batsman this time, and he plays a chipped drive over the covers
length ball, angling towards off stump. Bell lets it come on and pokes it away towards point
shot. That's full outside off, and Bell drives on the up, in the air, but well over the diving fielder at short cover
back of a length on off stump, dabbed to backward point
in the blockhole outside off, dug out towards short midwicket
on the pads now, and Bell executes the leg glance brilliantly, placing it into the gap to the right of short fine leg
full and wide, driven to mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump, blocked to short cover
back of a length outside off, looks for the dab to third man but can't beat point, moving quickly to his left
length ball on a fourth-stump line, defended to short cover
full and wide, driven elegantly to the right of sweeper cover
width again, not quite driving length this time, and Bell reaches out to ease it to sweeper cover
short now, Root pulls to deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven to point with an open face
length ball, angling in towards off stump. Root lets it come on and dabs it to short third man
back of a length on off stump, no real room to work with and he punches it to point
length ball, gives him a bit of width this time, and Root gets down on his knees to manufacture the height to cut, and he ends up halfway steering it, halfway edging it to the fine third man boundary
fuller now, closer to off stump, and he gets forward to drive to short cover
full on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
short outside off, pulled away to the left of deep square leg, who sprints to his left, slides, and pushes the ball to the approaching long-on fielder
full outside off, driven to deep point
full and wide once more, driven to that deep point fielder again
uppish, and that just about doesn't carry. It's not quite pitched up enough for the drive, and Bell drives uppishly, but it bounces short of Smith at short cover
full on off stump, controlled drive to the right of deep point
short ball over leg stump, and Root shuffles across and swivels to help it down to the fine leg boundary
length ball wide outside off. Root gets a good stride out to drive that to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to short midwicket
length ball outside off, and he opens his bat face but can't steer it past Maxwell at short third man
full on middle and leg, clipped away to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
length ball outside off, and he comes forward and pushes it to point
back of a length outside off, cut away to third man
full outside off, driven to short cover
full on off stump, angling in. Root gets his front foot across and clips it towards deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, dabbed to point
length ball outside off, steered to point
length ball on off stump. Bell shuffles across and pushes it back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, a bit of extra bounce, beats Root, who leans back and looks to slash
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
shortish, and Bell shuffles across and half-tucks, half-pulls it down to deep square leg to bring up his fourth ODI hundred. Well played!
back of a length on off stump and he gets on his toes to push it towards point
full outside off, drives firmly but can't beat Smith at short cover
slower ball on off stump. Bell initially shapes to drive, and then waits an age before dabbing it down to third man
angles this into middle stump, and Root steps across to clip it to deep midwicket
very full on middle and leg. Bell looks to flick it over the leg side, ends up inside-edging into his pads
slower ball on off stump, clipped towards mid-on
length ball on off stump, clipped with the angle towards deep backward square leg
low full-toss outside off, pushed down to long-on
length ball outside off, Root comes forward to steer it to third man
short outside off, gives Bell enough width to play the square cut, splits the gap between point and third man. Super shot
even more width this time, works to the bowler's advantage since it forces Bell to cut that in front of square, where they have sweeper cover patrolling the boundary
back of a length on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, Root looks for that front-foot steer again, can't beat Maxwell at backward point
back of a length on off stump, dabbed down to Sandhu at third man
length ball outside off, and Root comes forward to drive, gets a thick edge that beats third man diving to his left on the boundary
back of a length outside off, steered to third man with an open face
length ball outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
on the pads, and Root shuffles across and flicks it away to the backward square leg boundary. Poor ball with fine leg inside the circle
length ball outside off, steered away for another single to third man
full and wide, Bell reaches out and slices it to point
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away to the left of backward point
shortish, pulled away to the left of deep backward square leg
length ball on middle stump, tucked away to deep backward square leg
length ball, angling in towards middle and off, worked away to the right of mid-on
slower ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
full-toss on off stump, whipped to short midwicket
back of a length, tucked off the hips towards square leg
full outside off, driven towards deep point
length ball, angling in towards off stump, whipped away towards long-on
in the blockhole, just outside off, a bit of late swing away too. Bell looks to jam his bat down on it, ends up playing down the wrong line
full-toss outside off, sliced over the covers
fullish on leg stump. Bell makes room and pokes it away towards point
shortish slower ball, pulled away to deep square leg
short again, pulled again, and this time he hits it well in front of square and finds the gap to the left of the fielder on the leg-side boundary
another short ball, pulled to deep square leg
in the blockhole on leg stump, clipped away to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, chopped away towards deep point
back of a length, Root shuffles across and whips it from outside off to short midwicket
length ball on off stump. Bell makes room to slap it to sweeper cover
fullish on off stump, whipped away to the left of short midwicket
slower ball outside off. Bell clears his front leg, attempts the slog-sweep, can't connect
back of a length on off stump, Bell makes room to cut, it doesn't quite come on, and he can't beat short cover
lbw appeal as Root shuffles across to flick, they take a leg bye as it runs away into the leg side. Pitched outside leg for sure
makes room again, and this time he manages to cut it away from a middle-stump line and beat the diving fielder at short third man
back of a length on off stump. Root walks across and whips it away towards deep square leg
length ball on off stump, Bell clears his front leg and smacks that over mid-off. Excellent shot, pretty poor ball in the circumstances
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
fullish on the pads, clipped away towards deep square leg, and he takes two to complete his half-century
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, and the Bell dab to third man makes another appearance
fullish slower ball on off stump, checked drive to mid-off
back of a length outside off, steered towards sweeper cover
shortish slower ball outside off. Root shuffles across to pull it to deep square leg
down the track, making himself room. Faulkner sees Bell coming and slides the slower ball wide outside off. Bell goes for the big hit over cover, can't connect
back of a length outside off and Bell slashes it over backward point. Henriques sprints around from sweeper cover and cuts it off on the slide
down the track again, whipped away from middle stump towards deep midwicket
short, Bell goes for the pull from wide outside off, top-edges it but it still carries all the way over the ropes and into the stands behind the square leg boundary
back of a length outside off, steered to third man
length ball outside off, steered to third man
length ball on off stump, Root looks to make room to punch through the off side, it doesn't quite come on and he ends up hitting it straight to mid-off
short again, angling in, a bit of extra bounce to beat Bell's attempted pull
in the blockhole outside off. Bell opens his bat face to steer it but can't beat Maxwell at backward point
shortish on off stump, pulled away towards deep square leg

that is that. The slower ball ends Bell's innings. He comes down the track, Sandhu bowls it shorter, and he goes through with the attempted flat-bat smack over mid-off. Hits high on the bat, and it loops to the left of mid-off, from where Starc manages to backtrack and dive to his left to take a smart catch
fullish on off stump, clipped away towards deep midwicket
got him first ball! That was back of a length, angling across, and Morgan feels for it outside off, looking to run it down to third man, and gets a thin edge through to Haddin
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
length ball outside off, whipped away towards long-on
back of a length on a fifth-stump line, left alone
back of a length on off stump, dabbed towards point
on the pads, clipped away towards deep midwicket
low full-toss on off stump and Root walks across his stumps to scoop that over short fine leg. Top shot
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and tucks it to short midwicket
slower ball outside off, driven to sweeper cover
in the blockhole on middle stump. Root jams his bat down on it and it bounces up towards the bowler and he does well to stick his right hand out and stop it in his follow-through
shortish slower ball, pulled away to deep midwicket
length ball outside off. Buttler throws his bat at it and gets a thick outside edge that runs away to the third man boundary
tails into the blockhole on middle stump. Buttler swipes it away towards deep backward square leg
shot! Length ball outside off, and Root knows third man is in the circle and immediately gets in position to reverse-slap it powerfully to the left of that fielder
shortish outside off. Buttler counter-productively made room, and ended up having to reach across a long way to slap it to sweeper cover
slower bouncer, Root leans back, looks for the ramp, it's too high for him to connect
low full-toss, following Root who made room outside leg, and he clips it away towards short midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, follows Buttler, who can only dab it away towards point
gone! That's a length ball outside off, it was there to be hit, but Root, clearing his front leg, couldn't get any elevation on it, and he ended up popping it straight into mid-on's hands
length ball outside off, dabbed to backward point
fullish on middle and off, clipped towards mid-on to get off the mark
length ball angling across towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
down the track, and he bowls it into the newly created blockhole outside off. Jams his bat down on it to block it back to the bowler
slower short ball, and Buttler is too early into his pull, can't connect
in the blockhole just outside off. Bopara pushes and misses
full outside leg, clipped away towards fine leg
bouncer, and Bopara clearly wasn't expecting that. He is in a position from where he can only duck under it. Excellent end to an excellent over.
full outside off, angling away, sliced in the air, on the bounce to sweeper cover
full, follows Bopara who's looking to step away and make room. Misses the flick and it bounces off his front pad towards backward square leg
back of a length on leg stump, extra bounce into the hip region. Buttler can only tuck it down into the leg side
fullish slower ball outside off. Buttler's feet are frozen, and he plays and misses
another slower ball, wider outside off this time, was very close to the tramline, and the umpire judges it to be a wide
full on leg stump, clipped away to the left of deep midwicket
slower ball on middle and leg, tucked away into the leg side, where there are no fielders in the circle
short slower ball, rising over off stump. Bopara looks to pull, is into his shot too early, edges it into the off side
full and wide outside off. Bopara reaches out to slap it, can't connect.
middle-stump yorker, whipped away towards midwicket
now he bowls a back-of-a-length offcutter on off stump, eaves Buttler and beats him as he pokes at it with no footwork
short ball now, and he pulls it away towards deep square leg
full on off stump. Buttler goes over the top, slices it over mid-off, doesn't time it at all. The fielder can run back and cut it off well short of the boundary
slower ball outside leg, follows Buttler who had stepped away from his stumps. Hits his foot and bounces away towards point
full, sliding away outside off. Buttler aims a reverse-sweep at it and misses
down the track now, Faulkner shortens his length and bowls the slower ball. Pulled away towards deep midwicket
shortish on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
full-toss on middle and off, slapped to mid-off
full and wide, another slower ball. Root swings and misses, and it's close enough to the tramline for the umpire to signal wide
yorker on middle and off, clipped away to the right of mid-on
full-toss on off stump, and finally a boundary. Clears his front leg and smacks it back down the ground, over the ducking umpire to bring up England's 300
in the blockhole on off stump, and all Bopara can do is jab it back to the bowler

Bopara's standing deep in his crease and he bowls it very full once again, on off stump, and he swipes it away towards mid-on and sets off for a single. Would have been run out if Smith's throw had hit the stumps at the bowler's end
low full-toss on middle stump, poked away towards mid-off

bowled him. Bopara had taken guard outside off stump, exposing all of his stumps, and Starc bowled him around the legs, clattering the base of leg stump with a low full-toss that swung from outside leg

another, and it's a run out this time. Length ball, swinging away from off stump. Woakes swings and misses and they try to sneak a bye. Haddin's throw knocks back middle stump, and Buttler is short of his crease despite putting in the dive

and that's another run-out, is it? Yup, and Australia have a team hat-trick to finish the innings. Broad makes room and Starc spears in another yorker, just outside off. For some reason, Broad didn't even attempt a shot and they looked for another bye. Haddin rolled it into the base of the stumps, and Woakes was well short of his crease.

inn2.comm: and a boundary straightaway. It's full and wide, with a bit of outswing, and he gets forward and creams that drive through cover
back of a length now, angling in, and Finch defends off the back foot towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, and Finch jumps across to defend towards short midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards middle and leg, and he hops across to work it into the leg side, misses, and it's off the pad towards backward square leg
back of a length outside off, forced off the back foot towards cover
full outside off, drives it sweetly but straight to cover
length ball on a fourth-stump line, and Finch pushes at it with no footwork, it swings away late and takes his outside edge, runs away towards third man
that would have been a perfect delivery if Finch had been on strike, great line, great length, but it's the left-handed Marsh on strike and it's a wide down the leg side
length ball, angling across towards off stump, punched back to the bowler
on the pads, and he tickles it away very fine, races away to the boundary. Long leg was quite wide, and the boundaries in this ground are quite short
leg-stumpish again, and Marsh can't connect with the flick, but it runs off his pad into the square leg area
length ball on a fourth-stump line, defended towards short cover
angled in towards off stump. Finch, as he always does, hops across his crease rather than move forward or back, and tucks it into the on side, just wide of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched down the ground towards mid-on
angling in towards off stump. Finch hops across and clips it away towards deep backward square leg
full on middle and leg, and Marsh gets four with a lovely clipped on-drive to the left of mid-on
this one's more middle and off, but it's still too straight and Marsh once again splits the gap between short midwicket and mid-on. Super timing
overcompensates with both line and length, it's short and wide, and Marsh slaps it away clinically to the right of the short cover fielder
length ball outside off, and Marsh leaves it alone
full outside off, and Finch presses forward to drive on the up through extra cover
short now, a bit of width too, and Finch will feel he has missed out, flat-batting it straight to short cover
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Finch goes  back and across to push it towards mid-on
length ball on middle and off, defended down the ground towards mid-on
back of a length, too straight, tucked off the hips to long leg
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, defended back to the bowler from a typically open position, feet pointing down the pitch
length ball angling across towards off stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away past the diving fielder at square leg
fullish on a fourth-stump line, and Woakes does very well to get down low in his follow-through to stop that firm straight drive from Marsh
full outside off and Marsh leans into another crisp drive, splits the gap between short cover and mid-off
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot to mid-on
full outside off, Marsh shifts his weight onto the back foot and pushes that into the covers
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length now, outside off, and he jumps across a long way to punch towards mid-on
length ball, angled in from wide of the crease, not too far from off stump but a good leave from Marsh
angles this in a touch too far and Marsh works it off his pads towards deep backward square leg
fullish, angling in towards off stump, and mid-on does well to dive to his right and stop that sweetly timed drive. Finn was the fielder.
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, jumps across to defend towards mid-on
full on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
on the pads now, tucked away towards deep backward square leg
too straight again, worked away off the back foot to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended on the hop towards short midwicket
length ball outside off, defended towards short cover
shortish, angling in, and Finch pulls it away to the left of the man at short fine leg, front leg in the air
length ball outside off. Marsh gets a good stride out to play a checked drive to mid-off
angled in towards middle stump, and he shuffles across to work it to deep square leg
too straight again, and he shuffles across to work it from middle stump towards deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length outside off, and Finch goes back and across to defend to short cover
shortish outside off, and Finch plays a controlled short-arm whip-pull to the left of deep square leg
too straight, whipped off the pads to deep backward square leg
on the pads again, and it could have gone for four so easily, with fine leg inside the circle, but Finch nearly gets himself out, flicking uppishly and it bounces down just short of the fielder
leg-stump again, tucked away to deep backward square leg

full outside off and Finch goes up and over the covers, and Woakes and Taylor chase from cover and point respectively and put in a synchronised slide at the boundary. Woakes gets there first, flicks it to Taylor, who throws it back to the keeper
short and down the leg side, and he got a bit of glove on it as he looked to pull and that was enough to take it past the diving Buttler behind the stumps
on the pads once more, flicked away to deep square leg
full, angling in towards off stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Marsh shuffles across to work it to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off. Finch hops back and across to defend into the on side
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off. Marsh skips across and defends into the covers
back of a length outside off, punched back to the bowler
short and wide and Finch slaps it away to the left of Root at sweeper cover
fullish, a bit of swing in towards middle stump. Finch clips it away towards deep backward square leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off

lovely delivery, he's suddenly getting some swing here. Pitches leg and moves towards off. Marsh looks to work it leg side and he closes his bat face. It hits the back of his bat and then the back pad, runs away towards third man
full on the pads, flicked away to deep square leg
tossed up full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
tossed up, a bit of drift in towards middle stump, and he punches it back to the bowler
angled in towards middle stump again, pushed to mid-on. That seemed to go with the angle
bowled him! That was a poor shot from Finch, slogging across the line to a full, straight ball, and I think he may have yorked himself
down the track first ball, no surprises there, and he punches it firmly back to the bowler
down the track again, gets closer to the pitch of the ball, whips it to long-on
back of a length outside off, hops back and across to defend
back of a length again, a bit more width, punched to deep cover
full outside off, and Taylor dives to his left at short cover to cut off that drive from Marsh
length ball outside off and he comes forward and dabs it with the angle to backward point
back of a length on leg stump, a bit of extra bounce, and Marsh looks to tuck it off his hips and ends up dropping his bottom hand and fending it away towards square leg
back of a length outside off, Smith shuffles across to defend to mid-off
tossed up, angling in towards leg stump, driven down to long-on
fired in flat towards off and middle, driven down to long-on
tossed up slow, angling down the leg side. Marsh misses the flick, and it runs off his pad towards square leg
full, angled in towards middle stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, and Marsh gets his front pad out of the way to drive to long-on
back of a length outside off, turning in marginally towards off stump. Smith punches it to long-on
full on off stump, clipped to mid-on
full on off stump, a bit of shape in, and Smith shows the full face to drive it between the stumps and the diving mid-on fielder
shortish, rising ball that comes in to cramp Smith for room. He jumps to ride the bounce and drop the ball down towards point
full now, some shape in towards off stump. Smith defends down the pitch
swings in towards the pads, clipped away towards deep midwicket
full, angling across towards off stump, Marsh plays a checked drive to mid-off
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, and Smith whips it with a lot of bottom hand to square leg
length ball on off stump, punched down the ground, intercepted by Taylor at short midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
loopy delivery on off stump, defended towards mid-off
a bit of drift in towards middle stump, quite full, clipped to long-on
got him! Marsh has a propensity to slice the ball uppishly behind square, and Finn entices exactly that shot from him with a full, wide tempter, and he hits it straight to backward point
what a ball! That was angled in, towards a fourth-stump line, and it left White off the pitch. He poked at it without too much footwork and the ball beat his outside edge

stunning delivery, and he started celebrating even before the umpire gave it out. It was the inswinging yorker, and White's front pad was thrust across the crease, offering a large target, and there was no way he was going to bring his bat down and play around his pad.
back of a length outside off. Maxwell leaves it alone, lifting his bat ostentatiously over his head
full inswinger, and Maxwell stands still and clips it in the air towards deep midwicket

dropped! Full and swinging in again, and Maxwell flicks uppishly, to the left of Anderson at short midwicket. It went quickly, and he dived full length and got his hand to it but couldn't hold on. Tough chance, that.
full and quick, angles this too far down the leg side
full on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
down the track now, driven down to long-on
tossed up outside off. Maxwell comes forward to whip it to long-on
short, just a bit of width, and Smith makes additional room to cut it away precisely to the point boundary
a bit more air this time and he whips it from outside off down to long-on
tossed up on off stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
short and wide, and that's a spectacular-looking shot from Maxwell, stands tall, slices under the ball and sends it screaming away into the gap between point and cover
length ball, closer to off stump. Maxwell comes forward and caresses it to the right of the short cover fielder
back of a length on off stump, defended solidly to mid-off
shortish, doesn't bounce as much as expected. He swivels to pull and toe-ends it, dribbles away into the on side
length ball outside off, defended to mid-off
length ball on off stump, whipped away to the right of deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, clipped towards long-on
goes back to a length ball turning towards middle stump, and uses his wrists to poke that away towards long-on
a bit of air now and he comes forward to drive to long-on
a touch short and Smith rocks back in a flash to cut it away to the point boundary. His judgment of length is terrific, and he picked the gap clinically to the right of point
length ball on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
full, on middle stump. Smith shuffles across to whip that towards deep backward square leg
full on off stump, walks across to clip it towards deep square leg
shortish, rising to hip height, and Maxwell moves across to pull that away to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, and he moves across to whip it wide of short midwicket
back of a length outside off, and Maxwell dabs it to third man, does it in much wristier fashion than Ian Bell
fullish, angled in towards middle stump, clipped away towards deep midwicket
full and wide, and Maxwell comes forward and opens his bat face to steer it through the vacant slip region. Very deliberately done
looks to repeat the shot, but it isn't as full as the previous ball and it beats his outside edge
angled in towards the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
full outside off, whipped to long-on
full on leg stump, and Maxwell tickles it away to the right of the short fine leg fielder
length ball on off stump, Maxwell plays a checked drive to sweeper cover
fullish outside off, driven on the up to short cover
length ball outside off, and it straightens to beat Maxwell, who pokes at it with an open face
length ball on a fourth stump line, defended towards point
length ball on off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length on off stump, gets up on his toes to dab it to the left of short cover
full outside off, and he drives firmly but too close to short cover, who dives to his right to stop it
length ball on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
full outside off, and Smith shuffles across to whip it to mid-on
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
short on off stump, pulled down to deep square leg
full outside off, a bit of shape away. Smith reaches out and drives to sweeper cover
full on a fourth-stump line, driven to mid-off
down the track, checked drive to long-on
tossed up on middle and off, clipped to deep midwicket
gives it some air again outside off, and he whips this to long-on for another easy single
length ball, turns in towards middle stump, and he flicks it to the right of short midwicket for a quick single
tossed up high and slow on middle stump, driven to long-on
tossed up a little wider outside off, and he goes hard at the drive and hits it straight back to the bowler
back of a length, a bit of outswing outside off, and he shuffles across to dab it towards backward point
length ball outside off, steered to the right of third man
fullish outside off, Smith gets forward to drive to sweeper cover
shortish ball, and that's a superb shot, stepped outside the line and swung his body weight through his hips to half pull and half whip it to the deep backward square leg boundary
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
and again, this time it's Smith who picks up a dabbed single to third man
short ball, pulled away to the left of the long leg fielder
tossed up on off stump, whipped away to long-on
a bit quicker and flatter on off stump, and Maxwell presses forward but can't get to the pitch, clips it carefully to short midwicket
and he's struck again! Brain-fade from Maxwell, who sees a bit of air and goes for the big slog-sweep. Hits it well, but picks out Root at deep midwicket. He didn't have to move an inch.
goes back to a length ball on off stump, tucks it away to short midwicket
full on middle stump, clipped away to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, angling in, left alone
length ball wide outside off, and Faulkner leaves again
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
full outside off, driven to mid-off
a bit more width this time and he presses forward and drives into the gap between short cover and mid-off
length ball on off stump, and he comes forward and dabs it to third man with dexterous hands
full on off stump, defended with a turn of the wrists into the leg side
length ball on off stump, and he goes on the back foot to defend into the on side
fuller now and quicker, and Faulkner is hurried into a defensive clip to short midwicket
tossed up outside off, whipped to short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched down to long-on
tossed up outside off and Smith takes a big step down the pitch to drive to long-on
in the blockhole on middle stump, clipped away towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, a bit of movement away, and Faulkner pokes and misses
on the pads, clipped away into the on side
length ball on middle and off, defended into the covers. Smith ran out of his crease, and would have been out by a long way had Taylor's throw hit the stumps
back of a length outside off, left alone
full on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
drags this down short and Faulkner pulls it away powerfully to the midwicket boundary
tossed up outside off, and he stretches out to play a checked drive to long-off
back of a length on off stump, punched to straight midwicket
down the track now and he bowls it a touch wider. Smith drives it firmly, straight back to the bowler
very full on off stump, driven back to the bowler again
tossed up outside off, and again he can only drive it straight back to Moeen
back of a length on off stump, straightens a touch, and Faulkner defends from the crease
full on off stump and he shows the full face to drive that between the stumps and mid-off
back of a length on a fifth-stump line, and Smith shuffles across to work it into the leg side
on the pads, clipped away to the left of deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, and that's the first false shot from Smith, goes hard at it with an angled bat, looking to punch through cover, and inside-edges it past the stumps
full and wide and that's a cracking drive to the left of mid-off. Leans over the ball and punches through the line
flat, angled down the leg side and he whips it away to long leg
down the track, driven to long-on
shortish, angling down leg, pulled away to long leg
down the track once again, and Smith moves to fifty, appropriately, with another single down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball outside off, punched to cover point
back of a length outside off and he shuffles across to work it towards deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away to the left of backward point
back of a length outside off, steered with an open face to the left of third man
how does he do this so nonchalantly? It's a fifth-stump ball, and he simply shuffles across and whips it away into the leg side, wide of the man at short midwicket
sees Faulkner making room and bowls a slower ball outside off. The batsman goes for a drive, off-balance, and misses
length ball on off stump, dabbed down to third man
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended watchfully to mid-off
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length, angling in, defended into the on side
full outside off, whipped to long-on
on the pads now and Faulkner works it away towards deep square leg
inswinging yorker on leg stump, and he quickly gets his foot out of the way to jab it towards short midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to the right of backward point
length ball on middle and off, defended back to the bowler. That straightened ever so slightly
full on middle stump, clipped away to deep midwicket
length ball on middle and off, and Smith works it away to deep midwicket
down the leg side now and all Faulkner needs is a tickle and he gets that to send it flying wide of the diving Buttler behind the stumps
length ball outside off, pushed with soft hands to the right of backward point
length ball on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended with soft hands to the left of short cover
on the pads, Smith flicks it away to deep midwicket
back of a length now, tucked off the hips towards deep square leg
full on the pads, terrible delivery, and Smith flicks it up and over, wide of short fine leg, to the backward square leg boundary
back of a length outside off, pushed off the back foot to point
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to short midwicket

taken! Bell's grabbed a beauty. Faulkner was halfway forward to drive and it moved away late and caused the bat to turn in his hand and the ball to slice uppishly towards point. It was a low catch, inches off the ground, and Bell made it look much simpler than it was
back of a length outside off, defended towards point
back of a length outside off, Haddin is off the mark with a dab to third man
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and works it to short midwicket
angled in towards middle stump and he shuffles across to tuck it away towards the square leg boundary. Anderson comes around from deep midwicket and cuts it off with a dive inches from the rope
back of a length outside off, and Smith plays the best shot of his innings, standing tall and punching into the gap between point and cover
back of a length again, and this time Smith opens his bat face a touch too early and the inside edge rolls back towards the bowler
full outside off, and now they have a fielder at sweeper cover to cut off the square drive
length ball outside off, a bit of movement in off the pitch. Smith comes forward and defends back to the bowler
angled into the pads, clipped to the right of mid-on
length ball on off stump, blocked to short extra cover
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point
length ball on middle and leg. Haddin stays on the back foot, stays inside the line, pushes it back to the bowler
down the track comes Haddin, looking for the big hit over cover, and the thick edge flies uppishly towards third man
shortish outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, driven firmly to mid-off
starts the spell with a short ball that Smith muscles from outside off down to deep square leg
that's a favourite shot of Haddin's. Steps down the track and launches it over mid-off. Doesn't quite middle it, and it stops well short of the boundary
back of a length, rising ball on off stump, and he gets on his toes to ride the bounce and play it down towards point
length ball outside off and he shuffles a long way across to work it to long leg
short ball, sits up, and he pulls it away to deep square leg

length ball, angling in towards middle stump. Smith makes it look like a bad ball by shuffling across and glancing towards the fine leg  boundary, but if he missed that, it was a sure lbw. Thing is, he simply doesn't miss, does he? He stays upright and makes sure his head isn't falling over
fullish outside off, and Smith pokes it away towards backward point
short and very wide, and Smith slaps it away contemptuously to the point boundary. Did very well to reach out and get on top of the bounce. HotSpot says it went off the toe end of his bat
back of a length outside off and there's that big shuffle and the little tuck towards deep backward square leg
full outside off, sliced to backward point
full on off stump, angling in. Smith clips it towards long-on
sees Haddin making room and follows him with a leg-stump yorker. Pushed firmly back to the bowler
short and wide, slapped away to sweeper cover
slower ball outside off. Haddin slogs and misses
length ball outside off, swiped away towards the wide long-on boundary. Root sprints around from deep midwicket to cut it off
short and wide and Smith admonishes himself after missing the cut. That moved away a touch after pitching
short and wide once more, and it's punched firmly but Bell stops it with a dive to his right from backward point
back of a length outside off, whipped to mid-on
back of a length on off stump and Haddin steps away from the line and opens his bat face to steer it between the keeper and short third man. Cheeky and brilliantly executed
yorker on leg stump, follows Haddin, who jams his bat down to poke that to short midwicket

full-toss wide outside off and Haddin picks up another boundary, slicing under the ball to lift that over the backward point fielder. A fairly rotund spectator dives over the boundary hoarding and falls into the playing area in a doomed attempt at fielding the ball
length ball on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full-toss outside off, and he skips across to whip it to deep square leg
full on off stump, clipped to short midwicket
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
shortish and wide, slapped away airily to the left of sweeper cover
length ball outside off, and Haddin clears his front leg to launch that back over the bowler's head, sends it soaring high over the boundary, and a spectator drops a simple catch two rows back
a little fuller, and Haddin takes a step back into his crease to manufacture hitting room, and launches it into the long-on boundary, one bounce
back of a length, follows Haddin who backs away, and he dabs it into the off side for a quick single. Did well to keep that down, because that got a bit big on him and hit his glove
back of a length outside off, keeps low and sneaks under Smith's  bat as he looks to force it away through the off side
slower ball outside off, and Haddin lets it come on and dabs it to short third man
full outside off, and he opens his face to drive that to deep point
full on middle and off and he takes a step back and across and clears room to play the pick-up shot over backward square leg
full outside off, and he eases the drive to the right of the man at sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, and he shuffles across to work it to deep square leg
full-toss on off stump, punched back past the bowler, down to long-off

full on off stump and Haddin steps away from the line and extends his arms to loft that high over mid-off. Doesn't get the desired distance and Finn chases back a long way to try and get under it but the ball drops a safe distance away from him
shortish slower ball and Haddin swats it away towards deep midwicket
Taken! Finally someone in the crowd shows some sort of fielding skills, after a rebound off his friend's palms, no less. It was a length ball outside off and Smith sent that soaring over long-on
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
slower ball, short ball, pulled round to deep square leg
short, down the leg side, and he swivels around to pull it to long leg
short ball, pulled down to deep backward square leg, and Smith has a century on captaincy debut in ODIs to go with his century on captaincy debut in Tests. What a player he is.
slower ball outside off, and Haddin is beaten, through his pull shot too early
Woakes throws a bit of a spanner into Haddin's fifty plans, spearing a wide down the leg side

and he's gone. That's a short ball, a back-of-the-hand slower ball, and he made himself a lot of room and had to reach out a long way to try and connect. Ended up top-edging it, and the ball looped into point's hands
angles this into the pads, and Smith flicks it away to deep square leg
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
full on off stump, and he almost manages to split short cover and mid-off with the drive. Mid-off sprawls full-length to his left to stop the ball
full outside off, defended to short cover
full on off stump, and he flows into a good-looking drive straight to short cover
back of a length outside off, defended solidly off the back foot
full on middle and leg, clipped away towards deep midwicket, and that's Australia's 300
sees Henriques backing away and follows him, looks to flick but can't connect, is hit on the pad
full on middle stump and Henriques shows the full face to drive to long-on
length ball on off stump, pushed to short cover
down the track now and Woakes yorks Henriques, who can't get that drive past short cover. Smith was out of his crease at the other end and an accurate throw would have had him out

gone! That was right up there from Woakes again, and he drove firmly to mid-off and set off for the single. Nervy moment there, and Taylor's throw hit the stumps direct at the bowler's end. He was moving towards extra cover and only had one stump to aim at
full outside off and he shuffles across to flick it to deep midwicket and level the scores
length ball on middle stump and he makes room to slap it away through the off side. Bounces over the fielder at cover, and that's the winning hit
